origin_history: Seeds purchased and planted on Oct 8, 2025.
whats_been_logged: The plant transitioned from a lean sand-based soil to a more supportive mix with improved moisture retention and structure. Early stress from dryness and high alkalinity resolved as pH stabilized and seedlings showed consistent upright growth. Fertility remains modest but adequate for early stages, and leaf color has steadily improved. The plant has responded reliably to adjustments and is progressing toward fuller true-leaf development.
current_state: The seedlings are stable, upright, and expanding their true leaves with healthy green coloration. Soil conditions are balanced and appropriate for continued growth, with no visible signs of stress. The plant is well positioned to enter denser foliage expansion over the next several days.

timeline.what_i_should_see: Full True Leaves Across Most Seedlings
Dense Leaf Clusters Forming With Short Stems
Peak Lush Leaf Growth After First Cuts

journal.conditions: Sunny with a high of 82\xb0F dropping to 66\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro shows vigorous, upright growth with evenly green foliage and clear stem lengthening beneath the canopy. Soil moisture is balanced with no signs of saturation, wilting, or disease.
journal.actions: Do not water or fertilize today. Allow remaining soil moisture to be fully utilized.
journal.next_steps: Take the next probe reading tomorrow and water only if moisture falls below 30 mS/cm. Continue selective harvesting of outer stems as desired.

photos.caption: Overhead view showing balanced moisture, healthy leaf color, and dense cilantro growth.
Angled view highlighting upright stems and active leaf expansion under full sun.

journal.conditions: Patchy fog before 8 AM, otherwise partly sunny with a high near 84\xb0F dropping to around 61\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro shows healthy, upright growth with dense foliage and firm stems. Soil moisture has stabilized following earlier rain, with no signs of saturation stress, wilting, or disease. Minor outer leaf paling is consistent with normal canopy density.
journal.actions: Do not water or fertilize today. Allow natural overnight dry-down.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow late morning and water only if readings fall below 30 mS/cm. Continue selective harvesting of outer stems as desired.

photos.caption: Overhead view of cilantro showing balanced moisture, upright stems, and healthy green foliage.
Angled view showing dense leaf clusters and stable soil moisture following post-rain dry-down.

journal.conditions: Partly sunny with a high of 83\xb0F dropping to 67\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro remains healthy and upright with dense, well-formed leaves and firm stems. Soil is fully saturated following several hours of morning rain, but no signs of stress, yellowing, or fungal issues are present.
journal.actions: Do not water or fertilize today. Harvest outer stems only if desired, leaving the central crown intact.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow afternoon after natural dry-down. Resume watering only once moisture falls below 30 mS/cm.

photos.caption: Overhead view of cilantro showing healthy, upright foliage and saturated soil following morning rainfall.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high near 80\xb0F dropping to around 65\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro remains upright and healthy with well-formed leaves and firm stems. Soil is heavily saturated following recent weather, causing inflated pH readings and high moisture values. No signs of wilting, discoloration, or root stress are visible.
journal.actions: Do not water or fertilize today. Allow excess moisture to drain naturally and avoid disturbing the soil.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow afternoon after rainfall passes. Resume normal care only once moisture drops below 70 mS/cm.

photos.caption: Overhead view of cilantro showing healthy foliage and saturated soil following recent rainfall.

journal.conditions: Showers likely with a high of 81\xb0F dropping to 63\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro shows healthy, upright growth with full, well-formed leaves and clearly defined stems. Leaf color is even and vibrant with no signs of nutrient stress, pest damage, or wilting. Soil moisture is balanced and consistent across the planter.
journal.actions: Do not water today. Begin selective harvesting if desired by cutting outer stems while leaving the central crown intact.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow afternoon and water only if readings fall below 30 mS/cm. Monitor regrowth after first harvest cuts.

photos.caption: Overhead view of cilantro showing dense, healthy foliage and harvest-ready stem length.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high of 79\xb0F dropping to 62\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro is upright and actively growing with healthy green foliage and expanding leaf mass. Soil surface is dry and lightly crusted, causing probe contact failure and false high pH readings. Despite dry surface conditions, the plant shows no visible stress, wilting, or discoloration.
journal.actions: Apply a slow, thorough two-pass watering across the entire window box to rehydrate the root zone. Lightly break the soil surface crust after watering without disturbing roots. Do not fertilize today.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow morning or midday. Expect probe readings to normalize once soil contact is restored. Water only if moisture falls below 30 mS/cm.

photos.caption: Overhead view of cilantro showing dense, healthy foliage and active vegetative growth.
Top-down view of the window box showing dry soil surface and well-established cilantro clusters.

journal.conditions: Mostly Sunny with a high of 73\xb0F dropping to 53\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: The cilantro shows dense, upright growth with bright green, turgid leaves and no signs of stress or yellowing. Soil structure appears improved after filling the probe hole, light fluffing, and incorporating fresh Miracle-Gro Moisture Control Potting Mix, with even surface moisture and good root-zone contact.
journal.actions: Do not water today. Maintain current placement and allow the container to continue a gentle dry-down.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture in 1\u20132 days. Begin selective harvesting once stems reach 4\u20135 inches tall. Monitor nighttime temperatures but no protection is needed above 45\xb0F.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Discussed whether overnight temperatures in the low 50s were a concern; confirmed they are safe and beneficial for cilantro, helping slow bolting and support leaf quality.

photos.caption: Overhead view showing dense, evenly colored cilantro growth following soil adjustment.
Close-up of leaf structure and moisture beads indicating good hydration and turgor.

journal.conditions: Mostly Sunny with a high of 77\xb0F dropping to 52\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro foliage is dense, upright, and expanding quickly under ideal cool morning conditions. Leaf clusters show increased thickness and healthy bright green coloration, indicating strong hydration and airflow. Soil appears evenly structured with consistent moisture distribution after the prior day's adjustments. No signs of overwatering, nutrient stress, pest activity, or disease were observed.
journal.actions: Do not water this morning, as moisture levels are ideal. Avoid fertilizing today, and maintain the planter in full sun as temperatures are favorable.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow midday and water only if readings fall below 30 mS/cm. Expect continued leaf expansion over the next 48 hours as conditions remain cool and sunny.

photos.caption: Cilantro clusters showing dense upright growth and vibrant coloration on a cool morning.
Side view of cilantro foliage revealing strong hydration and well-balanced soil structure.
Close-up of leaf mass showing active expansion and excellent plant vigor.

journal.conditions: Slight Chance T-storms then Showers Likely with a high of 83\xb0F dropping to 63\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro foliage is upright, vibrant, and continuing steady leaf mass expansion under cool favorable conditions. Soil moisture has normalized following yesterday\u2019s saturation, with readings showing an ideal mid-range value and improved surface structure. The probe hole was filled, the top layer gently fluffed, and a small amount of Miracle-Gro Moisture Control Potting Mix was incorporated into the surface, resulting in more even aeration and hydration across the planter. No signs of wilt, nutrient stress, or disease were observed.
journal.actions: Do not water this morning, as moisture is ideal. Avoid fertilizing today as nutrient levels remain appropriate. Maintain current placement with exposure to mixed sun and clouds.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture this afternoon if sun becomes strong; water only if moisture falls below 30 mS/cm. Expect noticeable leaf thickening over the next 48 hours due to excellent temperature and hydration balance.
follow_up: [4:38 PM] Sprayed Captain Jack\u2019s DeadBug lightly across the entire window box at soil level to eliminate or expose any cutworms that may have dropped into the soil and to prevent potential nighttime stem damage to cilantro and the other herbs.

photos.caption: Cilantro clusters showing healthy upright leaf expansion after soil adjustment.
Soil surface with improved structure after filling the probe hole and lightly fluffing the top layer.
Close-up of vibrant cilantro foliage in cool morning conditions.

journal.conditions: Slight Chance T-storms then Showers Likely with a high of 83\xb0F dropping to 63\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro foliage is lush, upright, and bright green, with continued expansion of true leaves across the main clusters. The soil is fully saturated from rain, consistent with the high moisture reading. No signs of stress, wilt, or nutrient issues were observed despite elevated moisture. Leaf mass is progressing well toward first harvestable stems.
journal.actions: Do not water today as the soil is fully saturated. Leave the planter in its current position and avoid fertilizing while moisture remains high.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow midday as conditions clear. If moisture stays above 70 mS/cm, lightly aerate only the top half inch of soil to improve airflow without disturbing roots. Monitor for continued leaf thickening as the plant approaches early harvest stage.

photos.caption: Cilantro showing vigorous true leaf expansion and bright green foliage following overnight rain.
Soil surface visibly saturated after rainfall, matching the high moisture reading.
Close-up of dense cilantro foliage with strong upright posture.

journal.conditions: Patchy fog early, becoming sunny with a high near 86\xb0F. Light breeze with dry air contributing to faster surface evaporation. Overnight low expected around 66\xb0F.
journal.observations: Cilantro is healthy and vigorous with bright, full foliage consistent with active Leaf Mass Expansion.
journal.actions: A moderate watering was needed to rehydrate the upper soil layers and stabilize moisture levels for ongoing leaf mass development.
journal.next_steps: Monitor moisture again tomorrow midday.
follow_up: [2:00 PM] Watered lightly to rehydrate the upper soil zone after dry midday conditions.

photos.caption: Digital sensor readings on 12/07 showing moderate moisture, ideal pH, and low salts under warm sunny conditions.
Cilantro tray on 12/07 with dense, bright green foliage in active Leaf Mass Expansion.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high of 82\xb0F dropping to 62\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro continues vigorous growth and today marks the transition into Leaf Mass Expansion.
journal.actions: Light watering recommended after reading to correct dry upper soil.
journal.next_steps: Monitor moisture and avoid allowing top layers to fully dry during expansion stage.

photos.caption: Cilantro canopy showing thickening structure consistent with early Leaf Mass Expansion on 12/03.
Digital readings on 12/03 showing low moisture and temporary pH spike due to dry soil.

journal.conditions: Mostly cloudy with temperatures reaching 84\xb0F and dropping to 67\xb0F overnight. Wind gusts up to 19 mph with intermittent full sun.
journal.observations: Cilantro thriving with dense true-leaf growth; moisture is ideal for mid-morning despite recent sunny conditions.
journal.actions: No watering performed at time of reading.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture late afternoon; water only if below 30.

photos.caption: Digital readings for cilantro on 12/02 showing ideal hydration and balanced nutrients.
Cilantro seedlings under partly sunny conditions with strong foliar development.

journal.conditions: Mostly cloudy with temperatures in the mid-70s\xb0F and elevated humidity. Slight chance of evening showers.
journal.observations: Cilantro lush and deeply hydrated with strong true-leaf density; soil fully saturated due to recent watering and low evaporation.
journal.actions: No watering performed due to fully saturated soil.
journal.next_steps: Skip watering next morning; recheck midday.

photos.caption: Digital readings on 12/01 showing full saturation and high humidity.
Cilantro canopy fully hydrated with strong foliar growth.
Close-up of cilantro foliage expansion on 12/01.

journal.conditions: Cloudy with a high of 72\xb0F and a low of 57\xb0F.
journal.observations: Cilantro seedlings vigorous; pH reading clearly a sensor error due to cold soil and moderate moisture.
journal.actions: No watering performed.
journal.next_steps: Check moisture in afternoon; water only if below 25.

photos.caption: Digital readings on 11/28 with known false-high pH spike.
Cilantro seedlings expanding true leaves under cool cloudy weather.

journal.conditions: Cloudy with a high of 81\xb0F and rain expected around 6:00 PM.
journal.observations: Cilantro reached the Full True Leaf stage today with dense mature foliage and excellent hydration.
journal.actions: No watering due to fully saturated soil and incoming rain.
journal.next_steps: Monitor drainage and avoid watering until moisture falls.

photos.caption: Sensor readings on 11/27 showing high moisture and peak nutrition.
Cilantro foliage on 11/27 reaching official Full True Leaf Development.

journal.conditions: Partly cloudy with a high of 81\xb0F and low of 61\xb0F. Soil was very dry in the morning.
journal.observations: Cilantro seedlings improved significantly after soil fluffing and rehydration.
journal.actions: Light morning watering performed before readings.
journal.next_steps: Continue monitoring dryness; water when moisture falls below 25\u201330.
follow_up: [11:23 AM] Gave it a good soaking
[11:24 AM] Fluffed soil gently where gaps were visible

photos.caption: Sensor readings on 11/24 showing low moisture after morning dryness.
Cilantro seedlings recovering well after hydration and soil aeration.

journal.conditions: Sunny with a high of 84\xb0F dropping to 63\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro seedlings continue to improve following the prior day's hydration recovery. Soil moisture is ideal and evenly distributed, with no crusting or dryness visible. True leaves are expanding with bright, healthy green coloration across both the denser right cluster and the improving left cluster. Fertility at 9.0% indicates soluble nutrients are now accessible after rehydration. pH readings remain excellent. Seedlings show no signs of stress despite full sun and warm soil temperature.
journal.actions: No watering or fertilizing performed at the time of this reading.
journal.next_steps: Optionally give a light watering in the evening depending on moisture levels. Continue twice-daily watering on sunny days until midday moisture remains above 25\u201330 mS/cm. Avoid fertilizing for now, as current fertility is adequate. Monitor leaf expansion over the next 24\u201348 hours for transition into the Full True Leaves stage.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings displaying hydrated soil, expanding true leaves, and healthy green coloration under full sun.

journal.conditions: Cool, sunny morning around 72\u201373\xb0F with RH near 42%.
journal.observations: Cilantro seedlings remain upright with good color, but the soil is critically dry. Moisture has dropped to zero again, preventing the probe from registering pH and indicating dryness throughout the root zone. Fertility, EC, and salt values are extremely low due to the lack of moisture. Soil surface appears crusted and pale, consistent with rapid evaporation from the sand/topsoil mix. Seedlings show no stress yet, but they are at the threshold where dehydration would quickly impact growth if not corrected.
journal.actions: Apply slow, thorough soak to rehydrate both the surface layer and root zone, ideally in two passes to allow the sand/topsoil mix to absorb water evenly. Gently fluff soil in areas with visible gaps, without disturbing roots, to improve moisture penetration and reduce surface crusting.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture within 20\u201330 minutes after watering to confirm hydration has reached depth. Continue with twice-daily watering while conditions are warm and the soil retains moisture poorly. Avoid fertilizing until moisture stabilizes for at least 24\u201348 hours. Monitor for any signs of wilt or leaf curl in the afternoon.
follow_up: [11:23 AM] Applied thorough soaking to rehydrate the sand/topsoil mix.
[11:24 AM] Gently fluffed soil in areas with visible gaps to improve moisture penetration and reduce surface crusting.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings upright and healthy despite extremely dry soil conditions on the morning of 11/22.

journal.conditions: Sunny with a high of 84\xb0F dropping to 60\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro seedlings appear healthy, upright, and expanding their early true leaves with consistent bright green color. Moisture has improved significantly since the previous day's critically low reading but remains on the drier side for seedlings, especially given warm afternoon temperatures. Fertility is still very low, though appropriate for this stage as long as feeding is timed carefully. pH is slightly higher than recent days but still acceptable, and soil temperature reflects typical afternoon heating. No signs of stress, wilting, pests, or nutrient deficiency are visible.
journal.actions: No watering or fertilizing performed at the time of the reading. Allow the soil to cool and stabilize through the evening, and plan watering based on morning moisture levels.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow morning to ensure the planter does not drift back toward dryness. Plan a very light fertilizer application in 2\u20133 days once soil moisture is consistently stable. Continue ensuring the planter is protected if overnight temperatures drop to 45\xb0F or below.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings displaying healthy upright growth and expanding true leaves in afternoon sunlight.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high of 83\xb0F dropping to 64\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Seedlings remain upright with expanding true leaves and healthy green color, but the soil is critically dry and outer seedlings show slowed growth. Fertility readings remain very low, though pH is stable and ideal. No signs of pests, disease, or stress besides dryness.
journal.actions: Apply thorough watering to restore moisture throughout the root zone. Do not fertilize today due to dry soil conditions.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow morning to ensure it returns to an adequate range. Plan a light fertilizer application in 2\u20133 days once the soil is evenly moist. Continue protecting the planter from overnight temperatures below 45\xb0F.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings in full sun with visibly dry soil surface.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high around 82\u201385\xb0F dropping to 64\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro seedlings are upright with healthy green foliage and expanding true leaves. Soil moisture is moderate, and slightly low fertility has not yet affected vigor.
journal.actions: No watering or fertilizing applied today because moisture is still adequate and seedlings are too young for stronger feeding.
journal.next_steps: Check soil moisture again within 24 hours and plan a light fertilizer application in 3\u20135 days if growth stays strong. Continue night protection if temperatures drop below 45\xb0F.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Reviewed that pH is near neutral, fertility is modest but acceptable, and that delaying fertilizer a few days will avoid stressing young seedlings.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings under full sun exposure.

journal.conditions: Partly cloudy with a high of 82\xb0F dropping to 65\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Cilantro seedlings show steady early growth with bright green leaves and upright posture. Soil appears evenly moist with slightly low but adequate fertility.
journal.actions: No watering or fertilizer applied today since moisture remained adequate and plants are still young and responding well to existing nutrients.
journal.next_steps: Recheck soil moisture within 24 hours and consider a very light feeding in 3\u20135 days if growth remains strong and fertility readings stay in the lower range.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Confirmed that current moisture and fertility levels are acceptable for this stage and that it is better to delay fertilizing slightly until seedlings are a bit larger.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings with expanding true leaves.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high of 81\xb0F dropping to 61\xb0F overnight.
journal.observations: Seedlings look healthy and upright with light green foliage and a uniform stand. Soil moisture and pH are within acceptable ranges for continued growth.
journal.actions: No watering or fertilizing applied today because digital readings showed adequate moisture and moderate fertility.
journal.next_steps: Recheck soil moisture within 24 hours and continue monitoring pH as it moves toward the 6.0\u20136.8 ideal range. Protect the planter from cold nights below 45\xb0F.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Reviewed that digital readings indicated conditions were acceptable and that no corrective action was needed beyond routine monitoring.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings in the window box showing dense, even growth.

journal.conditions: 67\xb0F in morning shade transitioning to sun within about 20 minutes.
journal.observations: Cilantro seedlings are upright and evenly distributed with improved green color and well-formed first true leaves. Soil now appears evenly moist.
journal.actions: No direct actions taken today because moisture and pH are in the ideal range and fertility has just entered the green zone.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture later today or tomorrow morning and continue protecting the planter from cold nights at or below 45\xb0F while monitoring that pH remains near 6.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Confirmed that the previous day's soil amendment and watering successfully improved moisture, fertility, and pH without stressing the seedlings.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings showing improved color and early true leaf development.

journal.conditions: Cool, sunny morning around 65\xb0F in full sun.
journal.observations: Seedlings remain upright and evenly spaced but soil is quite dry at depth with low fertility and alkaline pH.
journal.actions: Applied deep soaking, gently broke up the sand/soil with a fork, added potting mix between seedlings, and watered again to help moisture penetrate.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture within a few hours to ensure deeper soil has hydrated, then monitor pH over the next day and plan a mild acidifying rinse if it stays around 8.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Discussed that dry soil and high pH were limiting early growth and that amendment plus deep watering would help correct structure and moisture retention.
follow_up: [10:30 AM] Planned to recheck moisture and probe readings after the deep watering and soil amendment.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings after soil aeration and addition of potting mix.

journal.conditions: Cool, mostly sunny day in the mid-60s\xb0F; container brought indoors overnight for cold and returned to full sun.
journal.observations: Dense stand of young cilantro seedlings in sand/soil mix, bright green and upright with moist soil and no stress signs.
journal.actions: Container was brought indoors overnight for low temperatures and watered to ensure soil was evenly moist.
journal.next_steps: Keep soil slightly moist but not waterlogged and bring indoors or cover when night temperatures fall to 45\xb0F or below.

photos.caption: Cilantro seedlings in sand and soil mix after watering.
